neuralprocesses.architectures.convgnp moduleÂ¶

neuralprocesses.architectures.convgnp.construct_convgnp(dim_x=1, dim_y=1, dim_yc=None, dim_yt=None, dim_aux_t=None, points_per_unit=64, margin=0.1, likelihood='lowrank', conv_arch='unet', unet_channels=(64, 64, 64, 64, 64, 64), unet_kernels=5, unet_activations=None, unet_resize_convs=False, unet_resize_conv_interp_method='nearest', dws_receptive_field=None, dws_layers=8, dws_channels=64, num_basis_functions=512, encoder_scales=None, decoder_scale=None, aux_t_mlp_layers=(128, 128, 128), epsilon=0.0001, transform=None, dtype=None, nps=<module 'neuralprocesses' from '/Users/wessel/Dropbox/Projects/PyLib/NeuralProcesses/neuralprocesses/__init__.py'>)[source]Â¶

A Convolutional Gaussian Neural Process.

Sets the attribute receptive_field to the receptive field of the model.

Parameters

  • dim_x (int, optional) â Dimensionality of the inputs. Defaults to 1.

  • dim_y (int, optional) â Dimensionality of the outputs. Defaults to 1.

  • dim_yc (int or tuple[int], optional) â Dimensionality of the outputs of the context set. You should set this if the dimensionality of the outputs of the context set is not equal to the dimensionality of the outputs of the target set. You should also set this if you want to use multiple context sets. In that case, set this equal to a tuple of integers indicating the respective output dimensionalities.

  • dim_yt (int, optional) â Dimensionality of the outputs of the target set. You should set this if the dimensionality of the outputs of the target set is not equal to the dimensionality of the outputs of the context set.

  • dim_aux_t (int, optional) â Dimensionality of target-specific auxiliary variables.

  • points_per_unit (float, optional) â Density of the internal discretisation. Defaults to 64.

  • margin (float, optional) â Margin of the internal discretisation. Defaults to 0.1

  • likelihood (str, optional) â Likelihood. Must be one of âhetâ, âlowrankâ, or âlowrank-correlatedâ. Defaults to âlowrankâ.

  • conv_arch (str, optional) â Convolutional architecture to use. Must be one of âunetâ or âdwsâ. Defaults to âunet.

  • unet_channels (tuple[int], optional) â Channels of every layer of the UNet. Defaults to six layers each with 64 channels.

  • unet_kernels (int or tuple[int], optional) â Sizes of the kernels in the UNet. Defaults to 5.

  • unet_activations (object or tuple[object], optional) â Activation functions used by the UNet.

  • unet_resize_convs (bool, optional) â Use resize convolutions rather than transposed convolutions in the UNet. Defaults to False.

  • unet_resize_conv_interp_method (str, optional) â Interpolation method for the resize convolutions in the UNet. Can be set to âbilinearâ. Defaults to ânearestâ.

  • dws_receptive_field (float, optional) â Receptive field of the DWS architecture. Must be specified if conv_arch is set to âdwsâ.

  • dws_layers (int, optional) â Layers of the DWS architecture. Defaults to 8.

  • dws_channels (int, optional) â Channels of the DWS architecture. Defaults to 64.

  • num_basis_functions (int, optional) â Number of basis functions for the low-rank likelihood. Defaults to 512.

  • encoder_scales (float or tuple[float], optional) â Initial value for the length scales of the set convolutions for the context sets embeddings. Defaults to 2 / points_per_unit.

  • decoder_scale (float, optional) â Initial value for the length scale of the set convolution in the decoder. Defaults to 2 / points_per_unit.

  • aux_t_mlp_layers (tuple[int], optional) â Widths of the layers of the MLP for the target-specific auxiliary variable. Defaults to three layers of width 128.

  • epsilon (float, optional) â Epsilon added by the set convolutions before dividing by the density channel. Defaults to 1e-4.

  • transform (str or tuple[float, float], optional) â Bijection applied to the output of the ConvGNP. This can help deal with positive of bounded data. Must be either âpositiveâ for positive data or (lower, upper) for data in this open interval.

  • dtype (dtype, optional) â Data type.

Returns

ConvGNP model.

Return type

model.Model
